rtega_mnemonic:
値値RS
值值		price, cost, worth
  • person 人 being straight 直/直 about the true cost of something
heisig_constituent: price, person, straightaway, ten, needle, eye, fishhook
koohiiStory1: Mr. T (person) tells the used car salesman to tell him the real price straight away, and when he doesn´t he throws him through the windshield.
koohiiStory2: Mr. T is shopping for new chains. He knows what he wants and money isn´t an issue. "Cut the jibba-jabba, tell me the price, straightaway!".
jp_example_words:
値(あたい): value, price, cost, worth, merit
値する(あたいする): to be worth, to deserve, to merit
値打ち(ねうち): value, worth, price, dignity
値段(ねだん): price, cost
値引き(ねびき): price reduction, discount
価値(かち): value, worth, merit
値(ね): value, price, cost, worth, merit, (computer programming) variable
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A leader can fix the value of certain goods and services. Leaders basically get to decide how much everything is worth in value, like rice or lamps or how much you get paid for the work you do.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine having a wonderful leader who values your work and time and so the value you get from working is high. Now imagine a terrible leader, who thinks you should be working at all times and doesn't find any value in what you do. Life will be a lot harder...
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This leader has fixed the value of cheese (ち), making it ￥1 permanently. One yen! That's, like, less than a penny! Unfortunately, the leader won't fix any of the other really expensive things... so now everyone only eats cheese.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine if you could fix the value of cheese to something. How much would you make it cost? If you were a dairy farmer you'd probably be pretty pissed about the leader making it this low.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 直 (ただちに、なおす、チョク、ジキ напрямик), 置 (おく、チ класть)
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 化 (превращаться), 十 (десять), 目 (глаз)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (亻) is honest (直) about the price

値字的基本解释

値
zhí
同“值”。

値字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhí］
［《廣韻》直吏切，去志，澄。］
［《集韻》丞職切，入職，禪。］
［《中原音韻》音直，入作平，齊微。］
“値1”的新字形。
(1)遇到；碰上。
(2)犯，违犯。
(3)当；对。
(4)在轮到的时间内担任某项工作。
(5)指当值的班次。
(6)谓按物价所付的钱款。
(7)指物品的价格或价值。
(8)指物品与价钱相当。
(9)值得，有价值。
(10)通“直”。直接。
(11)通“直”。副词。只；仅。
(12)通“植”。拄立。
(13)数值，指用数字表示的量或数学式运算所能得到的每一个结果。

値字的康熙字典解释

【子集中】【人字部】　値； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页108第15
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】?直吏切，音治。【說文】措也。又遇也。又持也。【詩·?風】値其鷺羽。【註】値，値也。以鷺羽爲翳，舞者所執，以指麾也。　又與直通。【史記·甯成傳】無直甯成怒。　又物價曰値。或作直。

値字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
値字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhí］
["Guangyun" cut straight, go to the record, clear. ]
["Ji Yun" is a prime position, entry, Zen. ]
["Central Plains Rhyme" has a straight sound, smooth inward and smooth inwardness. ]
The new glyph of "値1".
(1) Encountered; met.
(2) To commit a violation.
(3) When; right.
(4) Take a job within the time of your turn.
(5) Refers to the shifts on duty.
(6) It is the money paid according to the price.
(7) Refers to the price or value of an item.
(8) Refers to the goods and the price.
(9) Worth and valuable.
(10) Through "straight". direct.
(11) Connect "straight". adverb. Only; only.
(12) Through "planting". Stand upright.
(13) Numerical value refers to every result that can be obtained by numerically expressed quantity or mathematical formula operation.

value
Name meaning
Nothing.
zhí
вм. 值
Radicals: ｲ, 直  (leader, fix)
Meaning Mnemonic
A leader can fix the value of certain goods and services. Leaders basically get to decide how much everything is worth in value, like rice or lamps or how much you get paid for the work you do.
Imagine having a wonderful leader who values your work and time and so the value you get from working is high. Now imagine a terrible leader, who thinks you should be working at all times and doesn't find any value in what you do. Life will be a lot harder...
Reading Mnemonic
This leader has fixed the value of cheese (ち), making it ￥1 permanently. One yen! That's, like, less than a penny! Unfortunately, the leader won't fix any of the other really expensive things... so now everyone only eats cheese.
Imagine if you could fix the value of cheese to something. How much would you make it cost? If you were a dairy farmer you'd probably be pretty pissed about the leader making it this low.
